summary: Email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorney Alison Moe and attorney Sigrid McCawley scheduling meetings/interviews with two individuals (one in Spain, one in New York) for the Epstein case. Discussions involve coordinating dates, video conferences, and travel logistics around a hearing with Judge Preska.

persons.name: Alison Moe
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York coordinating meeting schedules with defense attorney Sigrid McCawley to interview individuals related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Defense attorney communicating with prosecutors to schedule interviews/video conferences for two individuals (one in Spain, one in New York) and mentioning a hearing before Judge Preska.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney coordinating scheduling for witness interviews/video conferences in the Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduled meeting with individual
events.description: Planned meeting at 1:00 PM with an individual (name redacted) arranged by Sigrid McCawley and confirmed by Alison Moe's team.

events.title: Preska hearing
events.description: Hearing before Judge Preska regarding document release issues in the v. Maxwell case, scheduled for 11:00 AM.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors were attempting to schedule interviews with at least two individuals (one based in Spain, one in New York) in September 2019.
A video conference was proposed for an individual returning to Barcelona, with the possibility of flying them back to New York if needed.
A hearing before Judge Preska regarding document release in the v. Maxwell case was scheduled for September 11, 2019.
Sigrid McCawley referenced dealing with a hurricane threat in Florida affecting travel plans.
Multiple redacted names appear in the email chain, indicating coordination about specific individuals whose identities are protected.
